title: Strictly Come Dancing 2015: James Jordan hits out at Craig Revel Horwood
text:
Strictly Come Dancing 2015: James Jordan hits out at Craig Revel Horwood Strictly Come Dancing 2015: James Jordan hits out at Craig Revel Horwood 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
James Jordan has laid into Strictly Come Dancing star Craig Revel Horwood, after the judge criticised his wife Ola’s sexy calendar. 
The professional dancer lashed out at the acerbic TV judge, who said the snaps featured in Ola’s 2016 calendar are too raunchy for someone involved in a family show. 
James, Ola’s husband of 12 years, accused Craig of double standards, comparing the calendar to the judge’s autobiography, All Balls And Glitter: My Life. 
He told the Daily Mirror: “How can he say it’s not OK to sell a sexy Christmas calendar, but it is OK to sell his own book telling the world he was a drunken rent boy, and call it All Balls And Glitter? Innuendo, anyone?” 
The 37-year-old continued: “I’m pretty sure if one of the male dancers had brought out a calendar pouring milk over himself, he wouldn’t have reacted in the same way.” 
James also claimed the pay discrepancy between the judges and the dancers is unfair. Strictly Come Dancing judges Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Craig Revel Horwood, Bruno Tonioli (Ray Burmiston/BBC) 
“I can assure you, the professional dancers are paid a lot less than the panel for working flipping hard. They are training for up to 14 hours a day. Meanwhile, the judges are reportedly getting £110,000 for one day a week,” he said. 
Ola was paired with Olympian Iwan Thomas, until they were voted out in the first week of eliminations. 
Craig previously said dancers should not be allowed to feature in glamorous calendars. 
He told Woman: “There has been talk about banning dancers from doing sexy calendars and I think it’s a good idea. Share article 
“Strictly is a family show and then you have got Ola pouring milk all over herself with her legs spread. Fitness shoots are fair enough but sexy calendars aren’t what the show is about.” Promoted Stories
